Elementary:
An octopus has escaped from the National
Aquarium in New Zealand. It escaped from
its tank, slid down a 50-metre drainpipe and
disappeared into the sea. Inky – a common New
Zealand octopus – escaped after someone left
the lid of his tank open. Staff at the aquarium
believe that, in the middle of the night, when
there was no-one in the building, Inky climbed
down the side of the tank and travelled across
the floor.
